p:
Previous studies reported that the main components contained in the essential oils from S. hydrangea DC. ex Benth. depend on the part of the plant used and the collection zone. Caryophyllene oxide and β-caryophyllene
10, 27 ; and β-caryophyllene, 1,8-cineole, α-pinene and caryophyllene oxide
28 have been identified by different authors. Naphthalene, 1,8-cineole, camphor and α-terpineol are the main bioactives contained in plants at 2000 m above sea level, while 1,8-cineole, camphor, β-pinene, naphthalene and α-amorphene are those contained in plants at 1100 m above sea level
29 . Camphor, α-humulene
30 , α-pinene, 1,8-cineole, trans-caryophyllene and camphene
31 have been found in the essential oil from aerial parts of S. hydrangea and 1,8-cineole, caryophyllene oxide, α-pinene and β-pinene
32 are the major compounds detected in oil obtained only from the leaves of this plant.
